se.cbb.jprime.topology

Class RTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.topology.RTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sampleable, Dependent, StateParameter, AcyclicDigraph, Graph, RootedTree, RootedTreeParameter

    public class RTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements RootedTreeParameter
    Implementation of a rooted multifurcating tree topology where parents, and children are stored in arrays indexed by vertex number (the children of a specified vertex are, in turn, held as an array in no particular order). Null references are indicated as in its interface.

    Data such as leaf names, branch lengths, etc. are stored elsewhere, in maps. Completely empty trees are not allowed, nor are trees with vertices that may be collapsed.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RTree

        public RTree(NewickTree tree,
     java.lang.String name)
      throws TopologyException
        Constructor. Creates a rooted tree from a Newick tree. The input tree is required to be "uncollapsable", not empty, and have vertices numbered from 0 to |V(T)|-1.
        Parameters:
        tree - the Newick tree to base the topology on.
        name - the name of the tree parameter.
        Throws:
        TopologyException

      • RTree

        public RTree(RTree tree)
        Copy-constructor.
        Parameters:
        tree - the tree to copy.

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getComponents()
        Description copied from interface: Graph

      • getAncestors

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAncestors(int x,
                                             boolean properOnly)
        Description copied from interface: RootedTree
        Returns the vertices from x to and including the root, so that element i is the parent of element i-1. If no such path exists, an empty list is returned.
        Specified by:
        getAncestors in interface RootedTree
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        properOnly - set to true to start with the parent of x as first element, false to start with x.
        Returns:
        the proper/improper ancestors of x sorted so as to end with the root.

      • getLCA

        public int getLCA(int x,
         int y)
        Description copied from interface: RootedTree
        Returns the "lowest common ancestor" (a.k.a. "least common ancestor" and "most recent common ancestor", MRCA) of two vertices x and y, i.e. the vertex z closest to x and y such that that there is a path (z,...,x) and a path (z,...,y), or x=y=z.
        Specified by:
        getLCA in interface RootedTree
        Parameters:
        x - the first vertex.
        y - the second vertex.
        Returns:
        the lowest common ancestor of x and y.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Description copied from interface: RootedTree
        Returns the length of the longest path in the tree, i.e. 0 for a single vertex tree, 1 for a "cherry", etc. The hypothetical "arc" predating the root is not counted. See also getNoOfAncestors(...) for the "reverse" height.
        Specified by:
        getHeight in interface RootedTree
        Returns:
        the number of arcs of the longest path.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight(int x)
        Description copied from interface: RootedTree
        Returns the length of the longest path from a vertex to its leaves, i.e. 0 if the vertex is itself a leaf, 1 if it is a "cherry", etc See also getNoOfAncestors(...) for the "reverse" height.
        Specified by:
        getHeight in interface RootedTree
        Parameters:
        x - the vertex.
        Returns:
        the number of arcs of the longest leaf-path.

      • getSuccessorSinks

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getSuccessorSinks(int x)
        Description copied from interface: AcyclicDigraph
        Returns all "descendants" with out-degree 0 of a vertex x, excluding x itself. If no descendant sinks exist, an empty list is returned. The list is not guaranteed to be sorted or in any particular order. A null-graph returns null.
        Specified by:
        getSuccessorSinks in interface AcyclicDigraph
        Returns:
        the sink successor vertices.

        public void cache()
